title.narrative: Accelerating safe access to lifesaving sexual reproductive health for women and Girls in Ngala LGA

description.narrative:
The proposed project seeks to accelerate access to safe and lifesaving Reproductive Neonatal, Maternal, Child and Adolescent Health Services and GBV/protection towards addressing critical gaps in Sexual and Reproductive Health/GBV/ protection needs of new arrivals in Internally displaced persons’ camps and Host communities in the Ngala LGA, Borno state. Services will include community sensitization and awareness, provision of Emergency Obstetric care, Family Planning, HIV counselling/ testing Nutritional counselling and Support, procurement of life saving medicines and commodities, distribution of clean delivery kits and Hygiene kits to visibly pregnant women and girls, distribution of dignity kits to vulnerable women, support for referrals and linkages (including payment for treatment of complicated pregnancies and chronic reproductive health conditions like, fistula, Anemia. etc) . CARE will target mainly new arrivals in IDP camps and host communities with critical SRH gaps in the Ngala Local Government Area that has already been identified as a priority location for the project implementation. This prioritization is based on the findings of the joint rapid needs assessment that was conducted by the health sector, in collaboration with other implementing partners, which reported critical gaps in overall sexual reproductive health needs of new arrivals living in these IDP camps and host communities.
This project will directly target 3,665 women and girls of reproductive age and also indirectly reach sexually active men and boys living in IDP camps and host communities. The overall aim is to save lives and enhance timely, unhindered and equitable access to lifesaving sexual reproductive health and GBV/protection services through an integrated multi-sector assistance and protection approach by ensuring safe access to humanitarian assistance for the most vulnerable women and girls among the new arrivals affected by the protracted crisis in Borno state. The project intends to reach 25% of those in need of sexual and reproductive health services in the Ngala LGA, using projected figures on the NHF allocation strategy paper
